ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: yeah! take it! there will be vision science and not much neuro, prep yourself
Take this class if you don't mind a lot of reading!
Most definitely, especially if you are interested in cognitive sciences versus psychology.

A pretty typical senior psych seminar - studies to read each week, some discussion and debate. There isn't really much discussion, though - more similar to a lecture with a little participation here and there, which was underwhelming for a senior seminar. Make sure you're interested in the topics, some of them can get repetitive if you're not into social psychology. Professor Scholl is very knowledgeable and a great guy, but does talk a lot during class.

This course looks at the way that humans perceive social stimuli. I would definitely recommend the course - Prof. Scholl is really engaging, and the course material is very interesting. You have a bunch of weekly readings and a reading response, and then besides that just one final paper. The discussions are always really interesting.
